name: oral cavity carcinoma in situ
definition: An in situ carcinoma of the oral cavity that is located_in the epithelium. It is the most common cause of leukoplakia and associated with the development of squamous cell carcinoma. [url:https\://www.dermnetnz.org/topics/carcinoma-in-situ-of-oral-cavity/]

clinicalTrials.title: Study of Pembrolizumab (MK-3475) for High Risk Oral Intra-Epithelial Neoplasias
